pullrequest.title: Remove use of catkin-tools in ARIAC tutorial

content.raw:
actually I was trying to catch the result of the kill, with the thinking that if we aren't able to kill it, it was already dead. That is, if something is wrong in the world file or similar, gazebo will have already crashed (and brought the launch process down, since the gazebo node is "required") and we won't be able to kill it.

I did it like this (with `kill %%` instead of `timeout`) because I think it's necessary for the `gear.py` process to run in the background. There is probably still a way to use timeout on the `gear.py` rosrun - open to suggestions!!
content.html:
actually I was trying to catch the result of the kill, with the thinking that if we aren't able to kill it, it was already dead. That is, if something is wrong in the world file or similar, gazebo will have already crashed (and brought the launch process down, since the gazebo node is "required") and we won't be able to kill it.

I did it like this (with kill %% instead of timeout) because I think it's necessary for the gear.py process to run in the background. There is probably still a way to use timeout on the gear.py rosrun - open to suggestions!!
